author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Thithi: Kannada film, Thithi, is best Indian film of 2016 | Kannada Movie News - Times of India
text:
Here's more reason to cheer. The Film Critics Circle of India — a society comprising notable film critics from all the major film-producing states of India — has adjudged Thithi the Best Indian Film of 2016.
This is another feather added to the already illustrious cap of filmmakers Raam Reddy and Ere Gowda , who have been receiving one award after another for his film, which is a light-hearted story about three generations of men reacting to the death of their 101-year old patriarch, that is set in the Nodekoppalu village in Mandya district.
Raam announced this on his Facebook page, while also sharing that he will be launching his movie soon internationally. Way to go, Raam and Ere Gowda!
